body.name: Knives and Kisses: A Stolen Obsessions Valentine's Day Novella

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Couldn't put it down
reviews.reviewText: Read this in one sitting. It was impossible to put down once I got rolling!Cici was incredibly relatable as a fellow thespian. Her anger and determination reminded me so much of myself at that age! And the sense of not knowing where the performance ended and her true self began is something I still struggle with to this day.Valen is the most unique hero I've ever read! He gives off ALL the Gaston vibes but in only the best ways. Yes, he's completely self obsessed, but he is so genuinely head over heels in love with himself that it's disturbing and shocking to him when he sees Cici and she cracks open a part of him he had no idea existed. Every moment in his head was a trip! But I truly loved every minute of it!And the creme de la creme was a lovely cameo by my favorite psychopath of all time! Pax! I should probably be evaluated for how much I love that crazy killer.Spectacular novella from a spectacular author who very very quickly has become an insta buy for me.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewText: That was a good quick paced read! Ticked so many of my favorite boxes! Obsession, stalker, enemies to lovers, touch her and die, smut, and all that deliciousness! I was just looking for something for a Valentine's read and sure glad this is one I went with.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars weird… ok for a quick read
reviews.reviewText: Cici is a theater student in college trying to make her last shot at “fame” come to life in a Valentines Day play about Romeo and Juliet.She knows she will have to take care of her brother when she graduates (who is mentally incompetent and currently at an inpatient facility).Valen is “God’s favorite” (as he says many times). He is narcissistic, self involved star quarterback and frat president.Valen wins the title for their division and an awards ceremony is scheduled for the same day Cici’s play is (hers gets cancelled). When she finds out she immediately blames him and goes to his frat party to give him a piece of her mind.That back fires, as he apparently has an epiphany that he is obsessed now because she is “prettier” than him. And he needs to know more about her.He eventually fixes the date w the play vs the award ceremony. Cici finds out her BFF Corey only was around to try to get with her, which breaks her heart. They get into an altercation and she leaves, then Valen comes in and unalives Corey.Valen shows up to play Romeo in the play (since Corey doesn’t show, obviously) and in the middle of the play… a priest appears to marry Valen and Cici… I heavily eye rolled at this part. The audience were hand picked (people that wouldn’t protest when Cici fights the situation) and he forces her to say “I do”.THEN… he totally consummates the marriage right on the stage in front of everyone… super weird. Of course Cici is fine with it.I like the story and meat of the book but was really disappointed in Cici… she was very much no this is wrong then immediately changes to ok I’m good with it.All this takes place over 4 or 5 days…It was a lot…The story line / plot is good / cute but the whole dynamic between Valen and Cici is super weird.Valen is superficial and only concerned with himself but now all of a sudden he is being obsessed with Cici.Overall Rating: ⭐️⭐️⭐️Plot: 👩🏻‍💻📑📑📑Burn: 🔥🔥🔥Darkness: 🖤🖤Red Flags: 🚩🚩🚩🚩Kinks: 🫦🫦🫦Heat: 🌶️🌶️🌶️Range of Emotions: 😳😕🥵😕🫣Ending: 👩🏻‍❤️‍👨🏻 {HEA}POV: 👫🏻 {Dual}

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Clear your day, because you won't be able to stop reading!! If red flag book boyfriends are your thing - you need this book! Valen is an obsessed man on a mission! It's love at first sight for him, from the moment he sees Cici, she's his! And he won't stop until he proves to her that she is his and he is hers. He quickly recognizes that no one has loved/appreciated Cici the way she deserves and decides to make her happiness his priority. Loved every minute of it!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Buying The Physical
reviews.reviewText: That should tell you what I think about this book. I think my only con is I want it to be longer.I’m also hoping that his best friend gets a book too, because they both seem like birds of a feather.I want the book Cover to be the illustrator picture because that picture is beautiful!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Cupid with a dark twist
reviews.reviewText: I don’t have words to describe how much I loved this one! It was not at all what I was expecting but my gosh it was so much more than I expected! The entire time I was reading with my mouth hanging open in surprise.I love how Cici & Valen are complete opposites and his nickname/explanation for her? 🥹 love it.It was fast paced, sweet and f’d up at the same time. You’ll love it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Unhinged in the best way!
reviews.reviewText: It was so good that I finished it so quickly! Valen is such an interesting character and a little chaotic but you know he would do anything for Cici and that's what I want in my dark romances. The 🌶️🌶️ is so good and you don't have to wait long for it! Definitely a new fave!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars The Perfect Valentine Novella for red flag lovers 😉
reviews.reviewText: This Novella was amazing and well written! Red flags are just part of the holiday decoration lol! But seriously, I loved the couple characters brought in from Vow to Sever making an appearance. It was a quirky cute read for those of us bookish girls who love the red flag psychos 😉🥰

reviews.reviewTitle: What a crazy but delicious ride!
reviews.reviewText: It was everything I didn't know I needed, short but actually the perfect lenght, with all the perfect ingredients of an over the top dark romance.

Who doesn't want a self-centered, autosexual, privileged, god complexed jock stalking you and claiming you in dark and twisted ways?Aurelia Knight is a freaking genius at what she does. I devoured this book in one sitting. It was so hot.The characters are twisted but so entertaining, and the use of a plus-size FMC that refuses to take up less space is perfect. The MMC talks about her body without fetishism or negativity and "defends her" when somebody else does.A great valentines Day romance for dark romance lovers.Now let's hope we get a book for easter too 😉

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: Valen Throne will you be my valentine?
reviews.reviewText: Listen, I’m a need a little spice with my books kind of gal, but this? Even this had me blushing with some of the spiciest scenes I’ve read in a Novella. Following our football star and his new Chubby goth obsession, Valen Throne has never seen anyone more beautiful than himself. Until Cici.Thrown into an a tornado of the unknown, there’s one thing he’s certain of. Cecelia Harper is his, will be his and will ALWAYS be his. No matter how much she claims to hate him, he will make her love her.Cici is amazing. She’s a plus sized FMC where her size isn’t her personality and she knows she’s beautiful, she owns her beauty too. She’s confident, she wants to be a star and with Valen Throne getting in her way? She’s not afraid to confront the man who only sees himself and nothing beyond.Both are about to cut off more than they can chew.

reviews.reviewTitle: Check out bells book reviews on Insta
reviews.reviewText: It was okay. I don’t think I’ll bother reading it again. The character development and plot felt kind of juvenile. I think it would do better as a full length novel where the characters can actually be developed and it’s not so much that it’s a novella cause it can be done really well in novellas but the characters are portrayed as complex characters but without the development of their complexities. His preferences are complicated and it would’ve been nice to explore that more. As well as more in depth chemistry building. The spice was good that was probably the only redeeming quality. The lead up was lacking thou cause the chemistry was lacking. The dark romance aspects that were trying to be portrayed just kind felt thrown in there to try and make it darker but it didn’t enhance anything really, it just felt disjointed. I also was not a fan of the ending. I won’t spoil it so much as say it wasn’t necessary to go that way like it wasn’t realistic by any means. The spice in the moment was good but the actual event made no sense, it had been I think like 4 days, his fascination could have easily fizzled back to his base desires. It felt a lot like they didn’t see any other way for it to be a hea without that happening, like they couldn’t just be together without it. Spice was good I’m going to put it at a 3.5/5. It was frequent and descriptive. Overall, I gotta put it a 2/5. It really could have used some fleshing out and some more in depth development. I think the bones of the story are great but it really needed to be built up more to become everything it should have been.
There were grammar errors and it jumped around a bunch without setting the scene, made it confusing at times. Overall good
